title: Free Time Activities
summary: Essential verbs, phrasal verbs, and expressions to talk about free time and leisure activities, with clear definitions and example sentences.

sections.heading: Verbs and Phrasal Verbs for Free Time Activities
sections.content: This section covers common verbs and phrasal verbs used when talking about leisure and free time activities.

examples.definition: To spend your time at home instead of going out.
examples.example: Last night, I stayed in and read my favorite book.

examples.definition: To leave your home to do something enjoyable, such as visiting places or seeing people.
examples.example: Tomorrow, we plan to go out for dinner.

examples.definition: To have a meal in a restaurant instead of at home.
examples.example: On Saturdays, we usually eat out at a new restaurant.

examples.definition: To spend time in a place or with someone.
examples.example: This afternoon, I’m going to hang out with Tom and Alex at the mall.

examples.definition: To relax and take it easy, especially after something tiring or stressful.
examples.example: I just want to chill out at home after a long week at work.

examples.definition: To meet and spend time with other people.
examples.example: Weekends are the only time we can all get together.

examples.definition: To make music with a musical instrument, such as a guitar, piano, or violin.
examples.example: Playing the guitar in his free time is his favorite activity.

examples.definition: To spend time watching television or a film for entertainment.
examples.example: Last night, I watched a great movie on TV.

examples.definition: To start doing a new activity regularly for enjoyment.
examples.example: I’d like to take up photography this year.

examples.definition: To do physical exercise to keep fit and healthy.
examples.example: I work out at the gym three times a week.

examples.definition: To take part in games or physical activities such as football, basketball, or tennis.
examples.example: Every weekend we play football or volleyball on the beach.

examples.definition: To describe doing an activity like swimming, shopping, or dancing.
examples.example: This winter, we’d like to go skiing.

examples.definition: To describe doing an activity such as going for a walk or a run, usually for exercise or pleasure.
examples.example: Every morning before work, I go for a run.

examples.definition: To visit a location for entertainment or socializing.
examples.example: Tonight, we’re going to the theatre to see a play.

examples.definition: To learn something from a teacher, such as music, driving, or drama.
examples.example: Every Thursday, she has piano lessons.

examples.definition: To engage in electronic games on a computer for fun.
examples.example: He spends his evenings playing computer games.

examples.definition: To use the internet for browsing websites, communicating, or other activities.
examples.example: In the evenings, I go online to read the latest news.

examples.phrase: Spend time with someone / doing something
examples.definition: To use your time to be with a person or engage in an activity.
examples.example: I love to spend time with my family on weekends.

examples.phrase: Have fun / have a great time
examples.definition: To enjoy yourself and have an enjoyable experience.
examples.example: We had a great time at the amusement park yesterday.

examples.definition: To have a good time and take pleasure in what you are doing.
examples.example: At your party last night, I really enjoyed myself.
